clinical_study.brief_title: Erlotinib Is Being Studied With Or Without An Investigational Drug, PF-02341066, In Patients With Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1/2, Open Label, Randomized Study Of The Safety, Efficacy, And Pharmacokinetics Of Erlotinib With Or Without Pf 02341066 In Patients With Advanced Non Small Cell Adenocarcinoma Of The Lung.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1/2 study comparing the safety and anti-tumor activity of erlotinib alone versus erlotinib in combination with PF-02341066 in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLT) (Phase 1)
primary_outcome.description: Phase 1, first cycle DLT includes Grade (Gr) ≥4 hematologic possible drug-related toxicities and Gr ≥3 possible drug-related febrile neutropenia. Gr ≥3 non-hematological possible drug-related toxicities (except asymptomatic lab value elevation). Gr 3/4 nausea, vomiting or diarrhea. Gr 3 hypertension considered DLT if event unmanageable by approved pharmacologic agents or symptomatic sequelae despite medical intervention. Diagnosis of interstitial lung disease. Inability to deliver at least 80 percent (%) of planned dose during cycle 1 due to possible drug-related adverse events (AEs).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days up to 20 months, disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity
primary_outcome.description: Time in weeks from phase 2 study randomization to first documentation of objective disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression-Free Survival was calculated as (first event date minus randomization date plus 1) divided by 7.02. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]), or from AE data (where the outcome was "Death"; date of death reported in notice of death was used).

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-02341066 (Crizotinib) Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve During Dosing Interval (AUCtau) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 (C1) Day 1 (D1) i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is a measure of the plasma exposure to PF-02341066. In this study, it is used to characterize PF-02341066 exposure after a single dose (Cycle 1 Day 1) and multiple doses (Cycle1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-02341066 (Crizotinib) Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is a measure of the plasma exposure to PF-02341066. In this study, it is used to characterize PF-02341066 exposure after a single dose (Cycle 1 Day 1) and multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-02341066 (Crizotinib) Apparent Oral Clearance (CL/F) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D15 i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent oral Clearance is a measure of combination of the rate at which a drug is removed from the blood (CL) and the bioavailability (F) after oral dose. In this study, It is used to characterize PF-02341066 CL/F after multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-06260182 Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve During Dosing Interval (AUCtau) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is a measure of the plasma exposure to PF-06260182, a PF-02341066 metabolite. In this study, it is used to characterize the metabolite exposure after a single dose (Cycle 1 Day 1) and multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-06260182 Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is a measure of the plasma exposure to PF-06260182, a PF-02341066 metabolite. In this study, it is used to characterize the metabolite exposure after a single dose (Cycle 1 Day 1) and multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Molecular Weight Adjusted PF-06260182-to-PF-02341006 Ratio of AUCtau (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Molecular weight adjusted PF-06260182-to-PF-02341006 ratio of AUCtau is a measure of how much PF-02341066 (parent drug) was converted to the metabolite PF-06260182 after PF-02341066 dosing. In this study, it is used to characterize the metabolite-to-parent ratio exposure after a single dose (Cycle 1 Day 1) and multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Erlotinib Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve During Dosing Interval (AUCtau) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D-1 i.e., 1 day prior to initiation of continuous dosing of crizotinib; C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is a measure of the plasma exposure to erlotinib. In this study, it is used to characterize erlotinib exposure after multiple doses of erlotinib were administered alone (Day -1) and in combination of PF-02341066 (Cycle 1 Day 1 and Day 15).

secondary_outcome.measure: Erlotinib Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D-1 i.e., 1 day prior to initiation of continuous dosing of crizotinib; C1D1 i.e., 1 day of giving crizotinib and erlotinib; and C1D15, i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is a measure of the plasma exposure to erlotinib. In this study, it is used to characterize erlotinib exposure after multiple doses of erlotinib were administered alone (Day -1) and in combination of PF-02341066 (Cycle 1 Day 1 and Day 15).

secondary_outcome.measure: Erlotinib Apparent Oral Clearance (CL/F) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D15 i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent oral Clearance is a measure of combination of the rate at which a drug is removed from the blood (CL) and the bioavailability (F) after oral dose. In this study, it is used to characterize erlotinib CL/F after multiple doses in combination with PF-02341066 (Cycle 1 Day 15).

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Adjusted Means of Erlotinib AUCtau (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D-1 (i.e., 1 day prior to initiation of continuous dosing of crizotinib) to C1D15 (i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib)
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of adjusted means of Erlotinib AUCtau (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) is a measure of the plasma exposure to erlotinib after erlotinib dosing with crizotinib compared with that after erlotinib dosing alone. In this study, it is used to characterize the effect magnitude of crizotinib on the erlotinib exposure after combinational use of crizotinib and erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Adjusted Means of Erlotinib Cmax (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D-1 (i.e., 1 day prior to initiation of continuous dosing of crizotinib) to C1D15 (i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib)
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of adjusted means of Erlotinib Cmax (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) is a measure of the plasma exposure to erlotinib after erlotinib dosing with crizotinib compared with that after erlotinib dosing alone. In this study, it is used to characterize the effect magnitude of crizotinib on the erlotinib exposure after combinational use of crizotinib and erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Time in weeks from phase 1 randomization to first documentation of objective disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression-Free Survival was calculated as (first event date minus randomization date plus 1) divided by 7.02. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for PD), or from AE data (where the outcome was "Death"; date of death reported in notice of death was used).

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Median duration (50 percent [%]) of tumor response. Duration of response (DR) defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response [Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)] to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.02. CR: disappearance of a target lesions. PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants during phase 1 with objective response based assessment of confirmed CR or confirmed PR according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1). Confirmed responses: persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Level of Soluble Marker: c-Met Ectodomain (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 50 (Cycle 3, Day 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of soluble protein biomarker c-MET was analyzed at Baseline and at Day 50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Level of Soluble Marker: Hepatocyte Growth Factor (HGF) Scatter Factor (Phase 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 50 (Cycle 3, Day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Level of Soluble Marker: c-Met Ectodomain (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 50 (Cycle 3, Day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Level of Soluble Marker: HGF Scatter Factor (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 50 (Cycle 3, Day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days up to 20 months, disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Median duration (50%) of tumor response. DR defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response (CR or PR) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.02. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Confirmed CR, PR or Stable Disease (SD) at Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 6 and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants during phase 2 with confirmed CR, confirmed PR or SD according to RECIST 1.1. Also known as Disease Control Rate (DCR). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions. SD: neither sufficient shrinkage or increase to qualify for PR or PD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days up to 20 months, disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants during phase 2 with objective response based assessment of confirmed CR or confirmed PR according to RECIST (1.1). Confirmed responses: persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) at Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until death, up to 20 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time in months from randomization to date of death due to any cause. OS was calculated as (the death date minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4.

secondary_outcome.measure: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC), Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ-C30) Score at Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 21 days, up to 20 months
secondary_outcome.description: Phase 2 EORTC QLQ-C30: included functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), global health status, symptom scales (fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting) and single items (dyspnoea, appetite loss, insomnia, constipation/diarrhea and financial difficulties). Most questions used 4 point scale (1 'Not at all' to 4 'Very much'; 2 questions used 7-point scale (1 'very poor' to 7 'Excellent'). Scores averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher score=better level of functioning or greater degree of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire -Lung Cancer 13 (QLQ-LC13) Score at Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 21 days, up to 20 months
secondary_outcome.description: QLQ-LC13 consisted of 13 questions relating to disease symptoms specific to lung cancer and treatment side effects typical of treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. The 13 questions comprised 1 multi-item scale for dyspnea and 10 single-item symptoms and side effects (coughing, hemoptysis, sore mouth, dysphagia, neuropathy, alopecia, and medicine for pain). Recall period: past week; response range: not at all to very much. Scale score range: 0 to 100. Higher symptom score = greater degree of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of PF-02341066 and Erlotinib (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of cycles 1, 3, and 5 (i.e., up to 15 weeks) at 0 (pre-dose) and 2 to 6 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of PF-02341066 and erlotinib when administered in combination during phase 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Erlotinib (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of cycles 1, 3, and 5 (i.e., up to 15 weeks) at 0 hours (pre-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of erlotinib when administered as a single agent during phase 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mutations in Tumor Tissue (Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor tissue samples collected for molecular profiling were to be analyzed to assess Kirsten rat sarcoma (KRAS) mutations, mutations, amplification and expression of Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) and c-Met, and echinoderm microtubule-associated protein-like 4-anaplastic large cell receptor kinase (EML4-ALK) fusion in tumors.

other_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of PF-02341066 When Administered in Combination With Erlotinib (Phase 1)
other_outcome.description: MTD: the combination dose level of PF-02341066 and erlotinib in which 0/6 or 1/6 participants experienced DLT after 28 days of treatment (Cycle 1) with the next higher dose level having at least 2/3 or 2/6 participants with DLT during Cycle 1 of treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of PF-02341066 When Administered in Combination With Erlotinib (Phase 1)
other_outcome.description: If no more than 1/6 participants presented with a DLT during Cycle 1 at the MTD, then this dose level was considered the RP2D. If >1/6 participants experienced a DLT, then the previous lower level was considered the MTD and RP2D.

intervention.description: Erlotinib, 150 mg, QD will be administered orally on a continuous schedule (Phase 2 only)

For Phase 1 - escalating doses of erlotinib will be administered orally on a continuous schedule. The planned doses to be evaluated are 100 and 150 mg QD. The dose determined in Phase 1 will be used in Phase 2

For Phase 1 - escalating doses of PF-02341066 will be administered orally on a continuous schedule. The planned doses to be evaluated are 200 and 250 mg BID. The dose determined in Phase 1 will be used in Phase 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically proven diagnosis of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) that is locally advanced or metastatic and of the adenocarcinoma subtype (including mixed adenosquamous histology)
- evident disease progression by Response Evaluation Criterion in Solid Tumors (RECIST) after at least one but no more than 2 chemotherapy regimens for advanced disease
- tumors must have measurable disease as per RECIST
Exclusion Criteria:
- known interstitial lung disease
- prior treatment with an agent that is known or proposed to be active by action on EGFR tyrosine kinase or c-Met/HGF (Phase 2 Portion)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study was planned to include 2 phases; phase 1 was a dose escalation safety and pharmacokinetic (PK) study followed by a randomized phase 2 efficacy and safety study. The study was discontinued and phase 2 not started; no participants were enrolled in that phase of the study.

group.title: PF-02341066 (200 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)
group.description: PF-02341066 200 milligrams (mg) administered orally twice daily (BID) in combination with erlotinib 100 mg administered orally once daily (QD) in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

group.title: PF-02341066 (150 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)
group.description: PF-02341066 150 mg administered orally BID in combination with erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

outcome.title: PF-02341066 (Crizotinib) Apparent Oral Clearance (CL/F) (Phase 1)
outcome.description: Apparent oral Clearance is a measure of combination of the rate at which a drug is removed from the blood (CL) and the bioavailability (F) after oral dose. In this study, It is used to characterize PF-02341066 CL/F after multiple doses (Cycle 1 Day 15) of PF-02341066 were administered in combination of Erlotinib.
outcome.time_frame: C1D15 i.e., 15 days of giving crizotinib and erlotinib
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population was defined as all participants in the safety analysis set 1 who had at least 1 of the PK parameters of interest.

group.title: PF-02341066 (200 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)
group.description: PF-02341066 200 milligrams (mg) administered orally twice daily (BID) and erlotinib 100 mg administered orally once daily (QD) in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

outcome.title: Ratio of Adjusted Means of Erlotinib AUCtau (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) (Phase 1)
outcome.description: Ratio of adjusted means of Erlotinib AUCtau (Crizotinib + Erlotinib / Erlotinib Alone) is a measure of the plasma exposure to erlotinib after erlotinib dosing with crizotinib compared with that after erlotinib dosing alone. In this study, it is used to characterize the effect magnitude of crizotinib on the erlotinib exposure after combinational use of crizotinib and erlotinib.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (Phase 1)
outcome.description: Time in weeks from phase 1 randomization to first documentation of objective disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression-Free Survival was calculated as (first event date minus randomization date plus 1) divided by 7.02. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for PD), or from AE data (where the outcome was "Death"; date of death reported in notice of death was used).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: not analyzed due to small number of study participants

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (Phase 1)
measure.description: Time in weeks from phase 1 randomization to first documentation of objective disease progression or death due to any cause. measure.population: not analyzed due to small number of study participants

outcome.title: Duration of Response (Phase 1)
outcome.description: Median duration (50 percent [%]) of tumor response. Duration of response (DR) defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response [Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)] to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.02. CR: disappearance of a target lesions. PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: not analyzed due to small number of responses

group.title: PF-02341066 (200 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)

measure.title: Duration of Response (Phase 1)
measure.description: Median duration (50 percent [%]) of tumor response. Duration of response (DR) defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response [Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)] to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.02. CR: disappearance of a target lesions. PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions.
measure.population: not analyzed due to small number of responses

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (Phase 1)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants during phase 1 with objective response based assessment of confirmed CR or confirmed PR according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1). Confirmed responses: persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: Response Evaluable Population: all participants enrolled into the Phase 1 portion of the study who receive at least one dose of study medication (either PF-02341066 or erlotinib) and have an adequate baseline tumor assessment.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (Phase 1)
measure.description: Percentage of participants during phase 1 with objective response based assessment of confirmed CR or confirmed PR according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1). Confirmed responses: persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.
measure.population: Response Evaluable Population: all participants enrolled into the Phase 1 portion of the study who receive at least one dose of study medication (either PF-02341066 or erlotinib) and have an adequate baseline tumor assessment.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (Phase 2)
outcome.description: Median duration (50%) of tumor response. DR defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response (CR or PR) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.02. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 42 days up to 20 months, disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: Not analyzed due to phase 2 study termination

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Confirmed CR, PR or Stable Disease (SD) at Phase 2
outcome.description: Percentage of participants during phase 2 with confirmed CR, confirmed PR or SD according to RECIST 1.1. Also known as Disease Control Rate (DCR). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must decrease to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions and disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of nontarget disease. No new lesions. SD: neither sufficient shrinkage or increase to qualify for PR or PD.
outcome.time_frame: Week 6 and Week 12
outcome.population: Not analyzed due to phase 2 study termination

outcome.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC), Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ-C30) Score at Phase 2
outcome.description: Phase 2 EORTC QLQ-C30: included functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), global health status, symptom scales (fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting) and single items (dyspnoea, appetite loss, insomnia, constipation/diarrhea and financial difficulties). Most questions used 4 point scale (1 'Not at all' to 4 'Very much'; 2 questions used 7-point scale (1 'very poor' to 7 'Excellent'). Scores averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher score=better level of functioning or greater degree of symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 21 days, up to 20 months
outcome.population: Not analyzed due to phase 2 study termination

outcome.title: EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire -Lung Cancer 13 (QLQ-LC13) Score at Phase 2
outcome.description: QLQ-LC13 consisted of 13 questions relating to disease symptoms specific to lung cancer and treatment side effects typical of treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. The 13 questions comprised 1 multi-item scale for dyspnea and 10 single-item symptoms and side effects (coughing, hemoptysis, sore mouth, dysphagia, neuropathy, alopecia, and medicine for pain). Recall period: past week; response range: not at all to very much. Scale score range: 0 to 100. Higher symptom score = greater degree of symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 21 days, up to 20 months
outcome.population: Not analyzed due to phase 2 study termination

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of PF-02341066 When Administered in Combination With Erlotinib (Phase 1)
outcome.description: MTD: the combination dose level of PF-02341066 and erlotinib in which 0/6 or 1/6 participants experienced DLT after 28 days of treatment (Cycle 1) with the next higher dose level having at least 2/3 or 2/6 participants with DLT during Cycle 1 of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days (Cycle 1)
outcome.population: DLT evaluable population

group.title: All Treated Participants (Phase 1)
group.description: All participants who received PF-02341066 (200 mg or 150 mg) administered orally BID and erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of PF-02341066 When Administered in Combination With Erlotinib (Phase 1)
measure.description: MTD: the combination dose level of PF-02341066 and erlotinib in which 0/6 or 1/6 participants experienced DLT after 28 days of treatment (Cycle 1) with the next higher dose level having at least 2/3 or 2/6 participants with DLT during Cycle 1 of treatment.
measure.population: DLT evaluable population

outcome.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of PF-02341066 When Administered in Combination With Erlotinib (Phase 1)
outcome.description: If no more than 1/6 participants presented with a DLT during Cycle 1 at the MTD, then this dose level was considered the RP2D. If >1/6 participants experienced a DLT, then the previous lower level was considered the MTD and RP2D.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days (Cycle 1)
outcome.population: DLT evaluable population

group.title: All Treated Participants (Phase 1)
group.description: All participants who received PF-02341066 (200 mg or 150 mg) administered orally BID and erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. measure.description: If no more than 1/6 participants presented with a DLT during Cycle 1 at the MTD, then this dose level was considered the RP2D. If >1/6 participants experienced a DLT, then the previous lower level was considered the MTD and RP2D.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 28 days after the last dose of study treatment (up to approximately 20 months)
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: PF-02341066 (200 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)
group.description: PF-02341066 200 milligrams (mg) administered orally twice daily (BID) in combination with erlotinib 100 mg administered orally once daily (QD) in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

group.title: PF-02341066 (150 mg) and Erlotinib (100 mg)
group.description: PF-02341066 150 mg administered orally BID in combination with erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD in a continuous schedule for 28 days (Cycle 1) and then in continuous 21-day cycles. Prior to combination treatment, participants completed a 7 to 14 day lead-in period where they received erlotinib 100 mg administered orally QD.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The sponsor terminated phase 2 of this study; no data was collected during phase 2, leading to phase 2 outcomes not analyzed. The decision was based on strategic considerations regarding the clinical program only; there were no safety concerns.
